snippet: The arrivals who landed last month joined 75,000 others already there, but their marginalization in the region has muted their voice in the debate over their future.
abstract: Rohingya migrants who have recently fled persecution in Myanmar and safely joined some 75,000 fellow Rohingya in Malaysia continue to struggle under their status as refugees and unregistered migrants; barred from sending their children to government schools and unable to hold jobs legally, they face a long resettlement process and a bleak future.

byline.contributor: Austin Ramzy contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Jonah M. Kessel from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

lead_paragraph: The arrivals who landed last month joined 75,000 others already there, but their marginalization in the region has muted their voice in the debate over their future.

headline.main: Even in Safety of Malaysia, Rohingya Migrants Face Bleak Prospects
headline.print_headline: Even in Safety of Malaysia, Rohingya Migrants Face Bleak Prospects
